intro: Dorstenia contrajerva, commonly known as the "Congo spider plant," is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its unique, spiraling inflorescence that resembles a spider's web, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, with a hairy texture. Dorstenia contrajerva is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
